#Text=STAVE II : THE FIRST OF THE THREE SPIRITS
#Text=WHEN Scrooge awoke , it was so dark , that looking out of bed , he could scarcely distinguish the transparent window from the opaque walls of his chamber .
#Text=He was endeavouring to pierce the darkness with his ferret eyes , when the chimes of a neighbouring church struck the four quarters .
#Text=So he listened for the hour .
#Text=To his great astonishment the heavy bell went on from six to seven , and from seven to eight , and regularly up to twelve ; then stopped .
#Text=Twelve !
#Text=It was past two when he went to bed .
#Text=The clock was wrong .
#Text=An icicle must have got into the works .
#Text=Twelve !
#Text=He touched the spring of his repeater , to correct this most preposterous clock .
#Text=Its rapid little pulse beat twelve : and stopped .
#Text=" Why , it is n't possible , " said Scrooge , " that I can have slept through a whole day and far into another night .
#Text=Scrooge went to bed again , and thought , and thought , and thought it over and over and over , and could make nothing of it .
#Text=The more he thought , the more perplexed he was ; and the more he endeavoured not to think , the more he thought .
#Text=Marley 's Ghost bothered him exceedingly .

#Text=Every time he resolved within himself , after mature inquiry , that it was all a dream , his mind flew back again , like a strong spring released , to its first position , and presented the same problem to be worked all through , " Was it a dream or not ?

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= A quarter past , " said Scrooge , counting .

column1: #Text=" Ding , dong !

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= A quarter to it , " said Scrooge .

column1: #Text=" Ding , dong !

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text= The hour itself , " said Scrooge , triumphantly , " and nothing else !
